title: How to Reuse Boxes

steps.headline: Use boxes when you are moving.
steps.description: When you move to a new place you need a lot of boxes to pack! If you don't think you're going to move, give them to someone who is.

steps.headline: Use old boxes for presents and gifts.
steps.description: Not only are you making the earth happy, you're making people happy too!

steps.headline: Make boxes into toy boxes.
steps.description: Simply paint them and write your child's name. Once it is dry, you may place any toys or items inside.

steps.headline: Make safety kits.
steps.description: It never hurts to be a little safe.

steps.headline: Put your cleaning supplies in boxes.
steps.description: That way, kid and pets won't be messing with hazardous spray bottles.

steps.headline: Make a box shelf.
steps.description: You can put your piggy banks, books, and other stuff on it.

steps.headline: Place your cords and plugs in boxes too.
Use small cube boxes as blocks.
steps.description: You can wrap them with colorful tissue paper and then tape them. You can also paint them and let them dry afterwards.

steps.headline: Use boxes for pet beds.
steps.description: Make sure it's comfortable, that they can sleep right in it, and the bed fits them when they lay down.

steps.headline: Grow plants in them!
steps.description: You can decorate the boxes to make them look awesome and gorgeous.

steps.headline: Don't throw those cardboard jewelry boxes!
steps.description: Instead, store your jewelry there so it doesn't get scratched or lost. You'll be thankful when you do so.

steps.headline: Make a crayon box.
steps.description: Place crayons, coloring pencils, pencils, and markers inside.

steps.headline: Use boxes to give away toys and clothes for charity.You can also give them away at orphanages.
Make doll furniture from empty cardboard boxes of various sizes.
steps.description: You can even make a doll bakery.

steps.headline: Boxes are great for keeping little pets inside.
steps.description: Again, make sure there is room for your little critter and, of course, make it comfortable in its home.

steps.headline: Draw on boxes like you would on paper.
steps.description: You can share them with friends and family members. Maybe even your pets!
